values:
I'm so screwed
Current mood: grumpy

So recently when I was at the "doctor" she and I were talking about how the heck I will ever find someone who thinks I am as great as I am and will want to marry me and be my bff.
Well, she told me that although both men and women list "sense of humor" as one of the most important attributes in a potential mate, men want women who appreciate their sense of humor, not funny women. Dammit, I'm so funny that my friend who worked for Conan O'Brien told Conan O'Brien that I was the funniest person she ever met. I am so screwed.
I am doomed to be the girl who every guy likes to hang out with for fun, or in between girlfriends, but that they never want to get serious with.
That's it! From now on, no more Miss funny girl. I am going to be serious and sour 24/7. I will consider it a socialogical study, and see what happens.
It's going to be hard, I mean, I don't try to be funny, I just find myself saying stuff that makes milk shoot out noses, and bladders fail. I am not sure how I can change that. Shizzle, I am doomed, doomed I tell you!

1. Honestly, what color is your underwear?
blue

2. Honestly, whats on your mind?
How honestly I will answer these questions, and the red Sox game that comes on later

3. Honestly, what are you doing right now?
Listening to Wife Swap and answering this

5. Honestly, do you think you are attractive?
I've gotta be considered a sexy-beast somewhere

6. Honestly, have you done something bad today?
I ate macaroni and cheese for breakfast

7. Honestly, do you watch disney channel
No

8. Honestly, are you jealous of someone right now?
yes

9. Honestly, what makes you happy most of the time?
Trixie, my friends, The Amazing Race, the availablity of beer, livng near the ocean, my comfy bed, gay men, hot vendors at work, Dunkin Donuts coffee(which I can't get out here)

10. Honestly, do you bite your nails?
no

12. Honestly, have you had an eating disorder?
Who hasn't?

13. Honestly, do you want to see someone this very minute?
The guys who are supposed to come fix the oven

14. Honestly, do you have a deep dark secret??
Not after the last few weeeks, it came spilling out like milk from an udder.

15. Honestly, do you have a friend you don't actually like?
I don't socialize with or fake that I like people I don;t, so no.

16. Honestly, did you get laid today?
I wish

17. Honestly, are you loyal?
wicked

18. Honestly, are you in denial?
not anymore

19. Honestly, who would you wanna be right now?
Someone rich and anonymous with all the time in the world to do whatever I want and not get followed by the paparazzi

20. Honestly, do you like someone?
I always have crushes

21. Honestly, does anyone like you?
not anymore

22. Honestly, is it going anywhere with them?
nope

DIFFERENT EMOTIONS SURVEY


*Anger Section*

1. What do you do when you're mad?
It's not often, but I cry and or take action

2. What's the worst thing you've done when you were mad?
Said things that I regret

3. Ever made anyone cry when you were mad?
yes

4. Do you swear when you're mad?
sometimes

*CRYING SECTION*

1. Honestly whens the last time you really cried?
Watching the 9/11 documentary made by the two french bothers...amazing.

2. Ever cried yourself to sleep?
Yes

3. Do certain songs make you cry?
yes

5. What usually makes you cry?
Regret, the Oprah Winfrey Show, thinking about parts of my life, thinking about my future and wondering when the Hell I will get married and get to hav elots of presents

*Happy Section*

1. Are you normally a happy person?
Yes

2. What can make you happy
I am easliy amused

3. Does being with your friends make you happy?
Yes

*Self-Esteem Section*

1. Do you believe in yourself?
I believe in myself the way I believed in Santa as a kid...I know I exsist. Just kidding, heck yeah, I can do anyhting with enough time and training

2. When people say they think you are good looking/pretty, do you deny that you are?
I say "shut up, go tell some of the straight guys" it's always the gays who compliment me but I love it!

I am trying really hard to keep up with all the demands of my job but it's hard. It's so funny, cause I remember when I was in college I thought "Man I can't wait til all I have to do is work". and now I think "Man, I wish I was back in college." things were so easy then. Go to lots of parties, meet lots of boys, do some homework, hang out with the dorm mates, make excuses as to why homework is not done, party party party on weekends how fun!
Work life is overwhelming right now. I am so lucky to have the co-workers and friends that I have. they make it easier to manage.
So, thanks to Jenny from the block, Jonny. Erick with a K, tara, Holly, Elissa, Karen and Auntie Karen, Matty, Gregg, Danielle, Kellie, Darlene, Kipper, taylor and whomever else i forgot. you have made it so much better to get back into the grind after my horrible two week, but in reality, three month "vacation".
I am so lucky to work with fantistical people like you...you ah wicked pissah!!!
(Yes, that last sentence was for you Erick wiht a k). :^)

Stepford is alive and well

So, I moved to California four years ago..holy cow! I have lived in the OC since I moved out here. I love it...beautiful, scenic, not as many silicone parts as L.A, but still home to the beautiful people and I have such envy of the houses out here. I mean, a one bedroom condo in a crappy pre-fab area goes for 400K.
Anyway, I moved a month ago (back into an apartment with my friend Elissa pictures here with the purple wig...we are friends not lesbians, we both like guys, so any takers, here we are!) and it was a nightmare. I was supposed to move from Rancho Santa Margarita (aka the gateway to hell) to Mission Viejo.

Well, my friends showed up on the morning of the move with the truck, and we loaded all my wordly belongnigs in by 10:00am. Yay! So, we get a call from the new apartment complex here's a synopsisi:
Elissa: "Hello"
Apartement jerk: "Umm hi, I know you're supposed to move in right now and that your lease started at midnight, but we haven't changed the carpets yet."
elissa: Ok, well we've got the truck loaded and are on our way there.
Apartment jerk: " ok, I guess. It will only take an hour or so to change the carpets.
Elissa: "Whatever!" Slams the phone as much as you can on a cell.

So, we drive to the new place and when we get there the apartment leasing jackass says "Ummmm, I don't really want to let you see the place" So of course, we're like, "Oh it's on we are going there right now."
BTW, I had my dog with me because I though we were moving in.
So, we go to the apartment. We walk in and were overwhelmed with the kind of smell that would accompany most CSI episodes if they had smell-evision. Urine, feces, general nastiness. We walked in and I though "Oh my God, how will I live here it's disgusting???!!!!" My friend Erick pointed to a corner and said" Hey that's poop!!!" and then we all realized we were walking in cat litter.
We ran out in horror..not to mention that the carpets were stained black, as if the former occupant has thrown every bit of leftover drink, and food on the floor when he was done, and that he held his cats up in the air and rotated them around the carpet like a sprinkler when they had to pee or poop.
Man this is a lot to type.
So, we walked back out to the truck and a guy walks up to us and says "Hey, I've still got all my stuff in your garage, they are giving me a new garage today, so I'll be out in a few hours."
Okay, WTHell???? So, we are all talking about how horrible this is and how we can't possibly live there. My friends Jen and Matt offered me $100.00 per month not to move in. And Matt looks down at his legs and screams :"What's on us????!!!!"
Yupp, we were all infested with fleas. Including Trixie (my dog) she had them all over her, even running across her face!
So, I marched over to the office and said"You know how you have that 30-day satisfaction gauruntee? We're not satisified and we are not moving here!" The jackass leasing agent (We'll call her Heather cause that's her name), says "oh, even if we change the carpets?" I'm like screaming "HEATHER, WE ALL HAVE FLEAS AND SOMEONE IS IN OUR GARAGE. WE JUST WALKED THROUGH POO. HELL NO WE ARE NOT LIVING HERE. WE WANT OUR MONEY BACK NOW."
To which she replied: um we'll get you a check by Wednesday. Sorry...
to which I replied "HOW CAN YOU LIVE WITH YOURSELF AND LOOK ME AS A PERSON IN THE EYE AND TRY TO THINK IT'S OK FOR YOU TO RENT THAT PLACE TO A HUMAN PERESON. YOU SHOULD BE ASHAMDE AND FEEL HORRIBLE ABOUT YOURSELF. WHAT AM I GOING TO DO? I AM HOMELESS, THANKS A LOT!!!"
She kind of got teary which made me happy in a mean way.
So, i walked back over to the truck and saw the guy in the garage and it clicked that maybe he was the caveman who had been living in the apartment. So I asked him: "Did you live in number 88?" And he said (with no shame or hesitation) "Yup" and I said "You are a human, how can you live like that? I feel really sorry for your quality of life because residentially that is the most disgusting thing I have ever seen and WE ALL HAVE FLEAS BECAUSE OF YOU!!!!
He then screamed at me "LOOK IN THE MIRROR" Say what,
So I went back to the truck and almost started crying but instead we started calling every apartment complex we could think of and asked if we could move in that day. finally we found one. Of course it's like $200.00 more than we expected to pay, but it's beautiful.
It's in a magical place called Ladera Ranch. Until I moved here, I always referred to this place as a cult. It is perfect. Perfect lawns, perfect people, perfect houses, perfect 2.2 kids and dogs per family, parks on every corner.
Anyway, I am now a happy resident of Stepford, CA. Whatever they pipe into the air here has affected my senses and I walk around with a big crazy grin and say "Hello, how are you?" to everyone I pass while walking Trixie. It's awesome.
STW We're suing the other apartment complex.
And the absolute kicker is that hte guy who was in the garage refused to move into the other apartment that they offered him because it has "a bad smell". For real...
I watched Anchorman last night for the first time. I my gosh it was hilarious! I ♥ Will Ferrell!

Man, As much as Katie Couric makes my blood boil, Diane Sawyer brings joy to my news watching life. I am sitting here crying again over the dang 9/11 babies who are now 4-5 years old. What???? That's so long. And I'm watching Diane Sawyer swing the kids around and do ring around the rosey. Schmaltzy for sure, but I love it!!!
On another note, I live for the yearly special that Diane Sawyer does on those quintuplets...good stuff. 
I need a life!
I just saw a commercial that was an ode to the life of Steve Irwin (The crocodile Hunter) and I started bawling...man I have gone into an emotional cave!!!
I don't get Myspace at all. i am so much happier with my little old familiar LJ. But, I just got a vcr a few years ago and I still don't know how to work the dvd player.
Man the Red Sox suck this year!!!

so, for my birthday (and my roommates) we had a flair party. It's just shy of a costume party and super-fun. Here are some of the nice shots of the night... So fun that I had to have beer for breakfast...for real y'all, for real!

The ump just made the worst call ever in the Angels/White Sox game. If the Angels lose it will be beacuse of that call. Man that sucks...how can that be allowed? Why can't they watch the footage? They should really reverse that call. In fact, the home base ump calle dit a strike and out before the dumb White Sox guy ran to first. All the Angels watched the homeplate ump and started running in to change innings and then they changed the cal.

OOOOOHHHHUUUGGHHHH! I am so annoyed...I feel like a guy.

Something terrible happened last night. My friends and I went out to celebrate my roommates birthday. We went to dinner and then to a very "hole in the wall" cowboy bar. It was pretty boring, so we decided to go to a different bar. I should insert here that I was the driver and had nothing to drink. Actually, we were all really low-key for some reason. On our way to the next bar, we passed an accident that was really bad. We got re-routed through a parking lot and got kind of lost for a few minutes. We were thinking that i was kind of funny that we were lost in a parking lot. Then we went on our way. We got to the intersection the the bar is at, and were stopped at a red light. 

Suddenly, a huge crash happened in front of us! A car had gone through the red light and got hit by an oncoming car head-on. The on-coming car filled with smoke, and we could see in the other car that the passenger looked slumped over and in bad shape. I looked around and ran to the car that was filled with smoke. There was a tow truck next to us that we could see was calling in the accident, so we decided to get out and do something. We went over to the CRV first (not the car that caused the accident). There were 4 people inside. They all were able to walk, but one girl's shoe was stuck under the seat, so she was stuck and she and her boyfriend were panicking. We weren't sure if the car was on fire or what. Thankfully it was just the airbags that were smokey. I helped one girl who was hurt over to the sidewalk, and then went over to the other car. 

The lady in the passenger seat of the other car was not conscious and was barely breathing. I tried to talk to her, but no response. I didn't know what to do, but thought if I tilted her seat back it might help her breath or something. I didn't want to tilt her head in case she had spinal or neck injuries.  Her husband was having trouble breathing. The two girls from the other car were having trouble breathing, the two guys from the other car were cut up, but ok. I went to help the girls on the sidewalk and my roomie stayed with the elderly lady in the car. After a minute (so fast!!!) the fire dept showed up.
The ambulance took the elderly man from the one car to the hospital. Then they put a blanket over the elderly woman...she died. It was horrible. I had just held her hand and touched her head and tried to do something. It made me so sad. On the one hand, I do hope that my death could be that quick and painless, but on the other hand, that couple had no idea that the wife would die that night. The elderly man had turned left at the light thinking that it was green, but really, the straight lights were green, and the turn arrow was red. The man kept saying "I thought it was green...I thought it was green".

The guys in the other car were so shaken up. The driver had just moved out here with his wife. He was very upset.

It was so sad. I feel really glum today. I know there is nothing we could have done differently to make the situation different...it's not that. I am just not sure why we showed up at that light at that moment. I think it was God that led us there, sober, even though we were out for a party. I can't get the images out of my head. I wish there was a way to get back in touch with any of the people involved.
I just read my last entry. It's not true...I took a different job than the one I posted about. I am doing proprty management. It's a great job....stressful, but fun.

Within the last 48 hours:

I got a new job, one that I didn't even apply for. I am going to be doing HR for an assisted living company. I went in asking to do activities...go figure?!

I am leaving my current job on Thursday. Talk about perfect timing! As of Monday, I was about to be unemployed come Friday.

The new job is actually next door to the old one. I already know the place and some of the people.

My roommate called this morning and told me she thought she saw that the Red Sox were on ESPN..she doesn't even like baseball, so it was funny for her to call. So, I have spent the morning watching the Red Sox...what a treat!

Johnny Damon shaved his beard...he is HOT with a capital h.

I know, it's been a while..

So, no new job. This job hunting has become way harder than I ever expected. I have applied to so many jobs, been on lots of interviews and still...nothin!
California sucks in some ways:
 for example the fact that you have a degree does not matter, unless the degree is in the specific area that you are working in. So, I have a BA in Liberal Arts, and 12 years of experience, and am qualified for squat. The jobs I've been offered have paid nothing...seriously, not even enough to pay the bills. And the other jobs that want to hire me are nothing I would want to do. It sucks!
I may need to take something temporary and un-glamorous to hold me over until I can figure out what to do...get my Masters?

So, the job search continues. I am sending my resume out to a couple openings today. I think I could be happy with either one, and the money is close to what I'm making now. Please keep your fingers crossed or say a prayer for me! I have 7 weeks before I become jobless.
On another note, have any of you read Purpose Driven Life? Or done a 40 Days of Purpose bible study? I highly recommend it.

I almost had a ♥ attack last week when I thought Boston Rob's trickery had finally caught up with him. I thought Rob and Amber (or as I like to call them: "Robinambah")would be the last to arrive and thus, be out of the race. Here's a script of what happened that you should feel free to print and act out dramatically with friends and loved ones (Rob's words are typed phonetically):

Scene in the airport in India. Teams must get a flight to some other country that I can't remember right now...Turkey? Yes, Istanbul. All teams have purchased tickets on the same flight (and only one they all found available).

Boston Rob to Meredith and Gretchen: "Did you guys get on tha earliah flight?"

Meredith and Gretchen: "There's an earlier flight?"

B.R: "Foh real...did you guys get on the earliah flight oah tha latah one?"

Boston Rob looksa at the camera and says "I'm just screwin with them, theah's no earliah flight, I just wanted them tah get nervous."

At this time Meredith and Gretchen and Uchynna (or whatever his name is) and What her name go and get tickets on an earlier flight!!!! End Scene

Uggh!!! If Robinambah get shut out I will be wicked disappointed!

Wait a minute, Have I misssed a lot, or am I really  the first to mention the new Bravo Show "Showdog Moms and Dads"?! It is absoutely classic. Please tell me you will watch it if you have not already seen it. I love my dog and consider myself one of "those weird dog people", but there is something seriously awry with the people on this show. It is fantastic entertainment!

I am suddenly obssessed with Boston Rob. I have loved the Amazing Race since the first time it was on. This season  can't get enough because of Boston Rob! Yes, he's married now, Yes, his accent makes him sound "wicked retahded", but I don't care, he's hot!

So, I guess Brad Pitt was busy at his new house in LA this weekend. I did not get to practice either approach with him on dog beach. Oh well!
Trixie got something in her eye this week and after Dog Beach she came home and it started swelling up. She was walking around the house like the lamest most pitiful pooch ever. I took her to the vet the next day, and $111.oo later her eye is healing nicely. She has to use steroid drops in it for a week. Actually, I put the drops in her eye for her...she doesn't have the precise grip to do it herself. Too bad she couldn't wear a pirate patch! I always hope for that when eyes are injured.

I heard that Brad Pitt likes to take his dog to a dog-friendly beach in Del Mar (part of San Diego). Guess where Trixie and I are going Sunday??? That's right, I'm exploiting my dog for the chance to see Brad Pitt. My dog is darn cute and friendly...should be an easy conversation starter. My quandry is this: when I meet Brad and start witty conversation and flirting, do I play dumb like I have no idea who he is? Or do I put it out there and act like it's no big deal.
Hmmm, suddenly finding a job and place to live seem so un-important!

Sorry it's been so long. It was not intentional!
So, here's what's new with me:
1. Three weeks ago I found out I got a $10,000.00 per year paycut.
2. Two weeks ago I decided I needed to give notice at my job due to #1.
3. One week ago I worked up the guts to do #2 (haha!! do #2!!!)
3. Present tense: I am frantically looking for jobs so that I am not unemployed and homeless on June 1st (my lease runs out May 31, so that's the end date I gave work.)
So if you know anyone who's looking for a residential program manager with great flexibility and creativity who happens to love planning and running activities and events, point them in my direction!

So, maybe you remember how I mailed many of you the Jason Mraz Curbside Prophet cd last year at this time. Last night I saw him live in San Diego. It was the last night of his Curside Prophet tour. We got the tickets last week, kind of last minute. I was very annoyed to be paying $45 to see him live, but also didn't want to miss the chance. I kind of hate seeing artists who get pretty popular after they get big. I don't go for overblown self-important stage shows (except NSYNC...)
The show was awesome! First of all, it was in the Symphony Hall, so it was small and had great acoustics. Jason Mraz got his start in the coffe houses in San Diego, so there were loads of people he knew in the audience. It was really a personal and great perormance. He narrates and free-form sings the whole time. There's not a quite or boring moment. Even when he plays the popular songs from his album, he makes them unique and adds in new lyrics and musical interludes, that make it really cool.
If you ever have the chance to see him live in a similar venue, do it!

My designer friend/ gay boyfriend Stevie B. has recently found the recognition he deserves...sort of. He is featured in the summer edition of Better Homes and Garden/ Do It Yourself edition. It's a nice glossy four-page spread about his home! Yay Stevie B!!!!!! The edition is on stands until July 27th y'all! Get it while it's juicy!!!!!

Here's a little sampling of my life's recent excitement:

1. I saw the MaryKate and Ahsley movie New York Minute with the kids I work with. I loved every New York Minute of it. IT was cheesy, predictable and foolish! It was great! I can't wait till the Hillary Duff Cinderella movie comes out...hope the kids want to see it so I have an excuse!

2. I lost 5 pounds...bringing my total to 25. I still have about 40 to go, but at least I'm back in it a little. I took a many months break between the first 20 and this five, but I'll get there.

3. I hosted poker night last Monday for the first time since the Superbowl. It was fun. We didn't play too much, but it was still fun to have friends over and hang-out for a change. 

4. Trixie is 15 pounds now. She's 5 months old and really good! She is very funny and smart.It's almost time for her to have "the operation". I'm nervous about finding the right vet. I'm not wild about the one I've been going to.

I guess that's it for now.

Dear Journal,
I have neglected you for so long. Will you please accept my apology? Yes? Great! 
I pledge to write in you at least once a week. Even when my life is so boring that it is a waste of time and journal space to write about it.

It feels good to not have my journal mad at me anymore for the neglect I have inflicted!
Work is hectic, Trixie is hectic, my social life is so lame it hurts. That's about it for now!

While at the dog park yesterday, I saw a large rattlesnake. It looked like it had just eaten a bunch of mice, or maybe a small Chiuaua, I'm not sure. It wasn't moving or rattling, so that's a positive. A guy there got a stick and chased it out through the fence. Of course, there are snake holes popping up all over the grass in the park, so I expect to see more. I didn't know they are poisonous...dumb I know but whatever. Now I'm scared. I don't want my flesh melting and falling off due to a snake bite while picking up a tennis ball for Trixie! On a lighter note, I'm pretty sure that one of the guys from Blink 182 goes to the dog park. His name is Mark and he has a chocolate lab puppy named Sasha. She's cute and so is he. I really do think it's him. He looks and sounds just like him...I'll have to ask next time I see him.

Today at work I had to bring one of our residents to get a photo taken for her bus pass. The place we went to is a photo studio that takes really crazy pictures of babies and kids. The kind of photos where the kids are in a giant stork delivery pouch, or sitting on top of a gigantic frog or some other silly stuff. It's actually all really cute, but silly.
Of course, I had to ask if they take portraits of pets. They do!!!! Guess who is getting her portrait done this week end??? I can't wait to see how they come out. Hoepfully I can post one on here.
I seriously need to get a life!

Eeww...I can't believe I just used the title of that stupid song to start this entry. Anyhoo, things have been crazy and busy around here lately. 

Trixie is cute and so smart. I think it would be easier to have a dumb dog sometimes. She figures everything out! Also, she's almost completely potty trianed...it's unreal! We spend a lot of time at the dog park. It's a whole sub-culture. I love it almost as much as Trixie does. 

Work is busy but good.

No guys to speak of...just as well I guess.

I ♥ the show the OC. It's so trashy and great! The best part of last week was when they poked fun of their own crappy writing by having Luke say "Welcome to Portland Bitch!" If you watch the show you will get it, if not, I'm sorry.

Let's see, Trixie, work, guys, tv, I guess that's it. I need a life!

Here are two photos of my squat little puppy. She Spent all of one Sunday barking at me, so I caught it on film! The other is just a cute one of her foxy little self. Thanks to cslewis71 for sending me this!

I am alive. I no longer have a computer at home though. Work is crazy but great. Trixie is crazy and sometimes I want to kick her to the curb but mostly I just want to hug her and not let go. When I do that though she starts squealing and scratching and biting like a little razor-toothed machine and then I have to let her go. She's a freak and I wouldn't have it any other way!
I am not smart enough to know how to post photos on this thing, or I would share her foxy little image with you all.

P.S.:cslewis71 has photos of her and is not sharing!

P.P.S:I will sit down and write something interesting soon...

P.P.PS.: Thanks for the email today Miss Jeanne...it was wicked awesome! I'll get back to you very soon!

Puppies are hard work, man. I am exhausted from taking care of her. And, I'm lucky enough tkat she is with friends all day while I work (once she's potty trained she will go to work with me). By the time I pick her up she's pretty worn-out and semi-mellow. But still, it's tiring. 
She's so cute though.
Hector on the other hand is not so cute. Oh well, I'm not going into why, but take my word. It's fine thoug. I know that when the right one comes along, I'll know it. My friend Boogz said "If it's meant for you, it won't pass you by." I believe it. I'm just tired of waiting for it to stop passing me by!
I mailed a couple photos of Trixie to cslewis71 to help me post them. Once he has a chance, you will all be able to see the Trixatronic 2004!!

I have a huge crush on one of the guys who has been working at our site for the past three weeks. I have had the crush on him since the first second I started talking to him a few weeks ago. His name is Hector, and he's a foreman for a carpet business (he might own the company, I'm not sure). He is really a hottie. He's also funny and smart and bi-lingual and cool and fun to spend time with. One afternoon I broke my va uum and he fixed it for me. Seriously, given my love of vacuuming, that is the way to my heart. I was hanging out with him whenever possible when I was down at the building a couple weeks ago, and then I had to stop going to do other stuff. By the time I got back down there this past week, his work there was done and just the guys who work for him were still working at the site. I was sure I would never see him again and not get to slide him my number.
Saturday me and my friends parked there in order to hit the town for a big parade, and guess who was there making sure the job was all done and done correctly? Hector!!
Yay!! He has my number now and should call soon. The only problem is that when I put my number in his phone and he dialed it, it went right to my voicmail, and I never got a missed call or message. I hope he can get it together so that it will connect. 

In other news, Trixie is now driving me to drink. She spent most of yesterday barking and biting. I hope this phase passes quickly. The only thing that stops her is my throwing a Mountain Dew can with pennies in it on the floor when she starts barking. She hates that can. She was running through the room like it was going to jump up and bite her! I hate to say it, but it was secretly funny to see her streaking across the floor in a hurry to get away from that can.

Trixie is now mine. She is so cute it hurts. I love her more than anything I have ever laid eyes on. I have photos which I will mail to Chip and hopefully he can help me post. She's so cute. Did I mention how cute she is?????

Ok, here's the alleged final word on the Trixie situation. I am now getting a different baby Welsh Corgi, still a female, still to be named Trixie. She is going to be delivered to me on Tuesday somewhere out here in the Irvine area. This is much easier than trying to get the original Trixie from Texas to here. So, keep your fingers crossed that Tuesday is the real Dia de Trixie!!!!!

Sometime last week I went to check my mail at my old apartment (where I stay a couple nights a week through the end of the month). While going to the mailbox I passed a couple of cute guys who were skate boarding and riding a scooter around the parking lot. We said hello which almost nobody bothers to do in this stupid apartment complex. Anyway, I was sure that it was a guy from the current Road Rules/Real World Challenge whose name I wasn't sure of. Remember, I always spot quasi-celebs wherever I go. I was also sure that it wasn't him, but just looked a little like him. I didn't see the two guys again.
Until this morning. I was driving to the complex and the two guys were crossing the street.I was on the phone with Jen and said "Hey, there goes "Road Rules" crossing the street." Then I laughed cause I had nick named a stranger "Road Rules".
An hour later I was at the pool with Doug, and who happened to be sitting there but "Road Rules" himself. He and his friend popped open a Corona and I got caught staring. I apologized for staring and drooling and told them I was coveting the beer. They offered me one which I refused cause I was working. We ended up in  semi-long discussion about the work I do, the place we are building and one thing led to another. Turns out his name is Jeremy, he just got voted off of the Inferno on MTV (he said "I have appeared on a show on MTV called Road Rules, it runs Monday nights at 10 if you want to catch it" It was funny, not stuck-up, but rather like he was advertising for MTV) and he is a national speaker about abstinence and works for a church. He is a very commited Christian and seemingly nice guy.(Yes we had a very interesting chat about how people assualt Christians who drink alcohol...) He wants to come volunteer at Casa de Amma. The ball is in his court...he has my card and info. I hope he gets in touch. He is one of those people who reek of inner-peace and quiet confidence. Would be great to have him around our new place.

Well, it looks like Tuesday may be the day I drive to Phoenix to pick up Trixie. I am so excited to meet her and see her cute little fluffy Corgi self! Puppies are so cute and wiggly and have the sweetest smell. I do realize that after a day or two of having her I will post something more to the tune of "having a puppy sucks. They are noisy and pee everywhere!" But, for now I can't wait to get that little fluff ball into my arms and squeeze her cute chubby body.
I will need some help from Money or Chip to post photos. And, a friend has offered to take some photos of Trixie so I can send out birth announcements to my friends and family...should be funny.

This has been a whirlwind week! The move has gone fine so far. I live right on the same street as Mattributes which came in handy when I needed advice on issues with the tv, directions to stores and help opening the sticky bathroom window, etc... I will be moving the rest of my stuff slowly during the next month, which is a real luxury. I'll talk about the horrible movers we hired another time!
Things at work are awesome. Our designer (Stevie B) is back in town and is fun as ever! All our furniture, artwork etc, is arriving this week, so my time is being spent at the site instead of at my desk. I love it, but it means no time near a computer to do updates!
As far as the boys, I got a really funny phone call the other night from some guy named "Fabio" who was lookinng for "Brad" I'll transcribe the conversation further another time, but it was the funniest prank call I ever got. Turns out it was this guy Steve (who I had ended up calling Toby all night when we met a month and a half ago, even though his name is Steve) and his friend Ryan (not the one from Friday...another Ryan). They were scrolling through Ryan's phone and saw my name and decided to call me and joke around. It was funny. I'm supposed to call Ryan back, but I don't know which number is his...guess I'll call all the numbers in recent call logs. I just hope I don't call the angry I rish guys in the process.
Whew...Too much to update...it's getting a bit lengthy.

And I just got home. I got a call earlier in the evening from a guy I met last night who is visiting the area from Ireland. He asked me and my roommate to meet him out, which we did. While at the local cowboy bar, I started up a conversation with some guys who were decidedly not the cowboy types. You know, mesh trucker hats, thick eye glasses and sneakers with black socks (a style that I was also rocking...just the black socks and sneakers though. I look awful in glasses and can't wear baseball hats to save my life. Anyhooo...)characters really. They turned out to be really cool and fun! We gave them a lift home and stopped at the Harbor House for some chow on the way. I made the mistake of ordering a short stack of pancakes with my Bud Light...I'll never do that again. What a bad combination. 
So, when we got to their house, Ryan and Johnny (those are their names) said "Hey girls, we would love to play you a song inside, come in for a minute." We were like "Yeah whatever..." but went in anyway just for the laughs. They had a full drum set and an array of guitars to play. They played us three songs that were flawless. It was sweet.
We had to head home since it is now officially moving  day, but Ryan asked for my number before we left (go girl! haha!) I gave him my card with my cell # written on the back. He noticed that my last name is Farrell and was like "Uh, Farrell? like Perry? like Jane's Addiction????" And I said. "Yup, one in the same" He then played me my own private version of "Jane Says" which happens to be one of my all time favorite songs. It was really cool. Ryan may be one of the funniest guys I have ever met, except for the guy I went out with last weekend from Texas. But other than him, oh and Chip, Ryan is definitely the funniest guy I've ever met. I don't expect to ever hear from him again...but hope is what keeps us girls going.

I may be traveling to Texas next weekend to pick up my puppy. It's not 100% certain, but looks like it will be so. I will drive the 12 hours from San Diego to El Paso (I always thought it was much further,) to pick her up. Yup, her. It's a girl! I guess I will have a little Trixie or Josie...I can't decide now that the time is here!
I will let you know when I know for sure.

Hey guys, I need a favor. Could any one design a graphic for a tee shirt for me? I know the images and general idea of the words I want, but you could be as funny and creative as you wanted with the actual design.
I want to make fake sports team tee shirts for the staff to wear at work. We do not have any athletic team, but we always laugh about what we would name our team if we did. Our work place is called Casa de Amma. There are both llamas and a shih tzu who are special pets of the founders of our program...that said, here's what I would like:

1. A photo of a shih tzu looking properly grumpy, possibly engaging in boxing or some other sport. We would call the team "Amma's Fighting Shih tzu's" or something equally absurd that you could choose.

2. A photo of a llama with something about "Amma's Llama's" on it.

That's it. Probably won't seem funny to anyone else, but we howl over the idea of showing up at work with these tees on all the time. I have tee shirt transfer paper for my printer...just need someone creative to work some logo magic. 
I would send you beer in payment.
Thanks a million...please!!! :^)

If I hear one more entertainment news show refer to The Passion as "The violent movie the Passion" I may scream. What do they expect a crucifixion to be, sweet and mild? Of course it will be gruesome. I assume it will make me cry and feel like I betray my faith every time I sin since Jesus willingly died in a terrible, brutal and awful way for me. I have not seen the movie yet. I have also not seen Saving Private Ryan, Gladiator and a number of other films which I think are too violent for me to stomach. I have a very low threshold for useless movie violence. I do however, plan on seeing the Passion because I think it will be a moving and bold reminder to me that every time I sin in a way that I know hurts God, I am basically pretending that Jesus' death means nothing and is unappreciated by me. I think I may need the cold hard reminder that it did matter and my life is better for it.

Instead of packing up like I was supposed to be doing today, I decided to spend the time re-covering a couple of seats and sassing- up some lamp shades in anticipation of the big move this coming weekend. I got this really fun black linen with drink umbrellas embroidered in it to re-upholster two of my four zebra print seats for our dining table. The remaining two will go into my new bedroom which I plan on doing in blue, black and white. Should be interesting! 
I love the drink umbrella print seats now. They are so fun. I also made a couple of tables runners with the excess fabric and have more left over to do something else with. 
I got some fun black fringe to trim out a couple of IKEA wood basket weave lamp shades that cost $4.00 each. Now they are sassy and a half!
I burned the crap out of one of my fingers with the hot glue all in the name of high style. Time to get serious about the packing now, I cannot wait to move!

My friend Drew just gave me this one...it made me laugh. Thanks Drew...

http://www.amateurgourmet.com/the_amateur_gourmet/2004/02/janet_jackson_b.html

I have so much going on lately, it's great! I will list the stuff for you...
1. New apartment: locked and loaded. Waiting for me and ellie29 to move into on the 27th. It's nice, big and they waved all the usual fees for having a dog. Usually you have to pay a $500.00 deposit and $45.00 a month fee to have a dog. They are not charging me since my  doggie will go to work with me as a therapy dog! YAY! 
Our apartment is super-fly and only one mile from the beach.

2. Work has totally picked up lately. We hired three new staff and I get to train them. They are very nice and have hearts seemingly in the right place. I'm really glad about that.

3. The long awaited puppy should be coming any time now. I cannot wait for some puppy love.

4. Stevie B (my favorite designer of the "juicy" furniture fame) is returning to Orange County for the first few days of March. I can't wait to se him. Hopefully I can swing him by my new pad and get his free advice on what to do.

Damn Hawaii is hot! It's very hot, very humid and all my freckles have united into one giant pinkish tan skin tone. I know, I know, boo-hoo...I just had not much else to say, but had to say something since I spent the money to use this computer! Gotta go hit the beach (for the third time today!) Oh, there are tons of whales just off the shore and it is so cool to watch them flip around trying to impress the girl whales. I'm no girl-whale, but I am impressed. I haven't seen any turtles yet...too bad I was really hoping to run into one in the ocean. I guess that's all. No more checking email for me! Hope you alll are having a good week!

In anticipation of my trip to Hawaii Sunday, I did something I rarely do anymore...I bought two books. Don't get me wrong, I read all the time. However, I am a huge fan of the library and go there every two weeks to get my reading materials for free. But, it's hard to bring hard cover books in a carry-on, so thus the trip to purchase some books. I got one I have wanted since I read the teaser around Christmas. It's called Bringing Down the House by Ben Mezrich. It's a true story of how a bunch of guys from MIT took Vegas for millions of dollars. It's really awesome. I will be passing it around our poker circle as soon as I am finished! Speaking of which, I wonder where the photos of the Mrs. Fresheley's Creme Filled Red Velvet Fingers shenanigans are?! What's the deal moneysocal?

Here's a very brief overview of my superbowl Sunday: 9:45- Went to church 11:30- Did volunteer child care at church 1:15- Stopped at party store and (as if completely forgetting the teachings and beautiful experiences of earlier church time) fought off Orange County house wives for the last three football shaped helium balloons at the party store, bought some other stuff that made me laugh (ok, pom poms and a fake Oscar trophy to be explained later) 1:45- Got home and helped roommate arrange high-fat manly snacks on football shaped plastic trays while drinking a Negra Modela with lime 1:50- Gayed-up the ambiance of the Super bowl party by putting out balloons, football shaped dishes, and writing "Tom Brady is hot" on the window in window chalk while laughing profusely at my own humor 2:00- 7:00- Welcomed friends and proceeded to consume beer and approximately 5,000 calories and 632 grams of fat (mostly saturated) while watching my Patriots (finally) win the game in the last minute, and watching Jt get cozy with one now-famous boob 7:00-7:02- Held private award ceremony in which Mattributes won a bogus Oscar in the category of "Best male performance in a Saddleback Church Comedy Improv show" 7:02-whenever- Took my poker playing friends in almost every hand we played. It was only my second time ever playing...I won $7.00 9:00-9:03- Ate a heaping mouthful of "Mrs. Fresheleys Creme Filled Red Velvet Fingers"...later challenged Ellie29 to do the same for the huge sum of one American dollar...she did it. Waiting for the photo proof from Moneysocal. I guess that about sums it up. It was a fun day!
